title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.4: PUBLICS&PRIVATE Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVIC

description.narrative: By 2020, technical ministries and the private sector have enhanced capacity to deliver basic water, sanitation and hygiene services that are equitable, innovative, sustainable and accessible to households living in targeted areas, which contributes to Environmental Sustainability, Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By end 2020, women, adolescents and children including the most vulnerable utilize equitable and sustainable Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services in rural areas in times of stability and crisis.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, technical ministries and the private sector have enhanced capacity to deliver basic water, sanitation and hygieneservices that are equitable, innovative, sustainable and accessible to households living in targeted areas

description.narrative: In 2020, the Country Office contributed to the provision of WASH systems to at least 9,452 additional people, who gained access to basic water services. Over 6,920 people gained access to improved water, sanitation, and hygiene services at community and primary school levels. In addition, 41 health care facilities in the regions most affected by COVID-19 were also equipped with contactless handwashing devices. | Status:Met | As-of Date:26/01/2021
